verses.text: The burden which Habakkuk the prophet did see.

O \nd LORD\nd*, how long shall I cry, and thou wilt not hear!
\add even\add* cry out unto thee \add of\add* violence, and thou wilt not
save!

Why dost thou shew me iniquity, and cause \add me\add* to behold
grievance? for spoiling and violence \add are\add* before me: and there are
\add that\add* raise up strife and contention.

Therefore the law is slacked, and judgment doth never go forth:
for the wicked doth compass about the righteous; therefore wrong
judgment proceedeth.\f + \fr 1.4  \ft wrong: or, wrested\f*

¶ Behold ye among the heathen, and regard, and wonder marvellously: for
\add I\add* will work a work in your days, \add which\add* ye will not
believe, though it be told \add you\add*.

For, lo, I raise up the Chaldeans, \add that\add* bitter and
hasty nation, which shall march through the breadth of the land,
to possess the dwellingplaces \add that are\add* not theirs.\f + \fr 1.6 
\ft breadth: Heb. breadths\f*

They \add are\add* terrible and dreadful: their judgment and their
dignity shall proceed of themselves.\f + \fr 1.7  \ft their judgment…: or, from them shall proceed the judgment of these, and
the captivity of these\f*

Their horses also are swifter than the leopards, and are more
fierce than the evening wolves: and their horsemen shall spread themselves, and their
horsemen shall come from far; they shall fly as the eagle \add that\add*
hasteth to eat.\f + \fr 1.8  \ft fierce: Heb. sharp\f*

They shall come all for violence: their faces shall sup up
\add as\add* the east wind, and they shall gather the captivity as the
sand.\f + \fr 1.9  \ft their…: or, the supping up of their faces, etc: or, their faces shall look (Heb. the opposition of their
faces) toward the east\f*

And they shall scoff at the kings, and the princes shall be a
scorn unto them: they shall deride every strong hold; for they shall
heap dust, and take it.

Then shall \add his\add* mind change, and he shall pass over,
and offend, \add imputing\add* this his power unto his god.

¶ \add Art\add* thou not from everlasting, O \nd LORD\nd* my
God, mine Holy One? we shall not die. O \nd LORD\nd*, thou hast ordained
them for judgment; and, O mighty God, thou hast established them for
correction.\f + \fr 1.12  \ft mighty…: Heb. rock\f*\f + \fr 1.12 
\ft established: Heb. founded\f*

\add Thou art\add* of purer eyes than to behold evil, and
canst not look on iniquity: wherefore lookest thou upon them that deal
treacherously, \add and\add* holdest thy tongue when the wicked devoureth
\add the man that is\add* more righteous than he?\f + \fr 1.13  \ft iniquity: or,
grievance\f*

And makest men as the fishes of the sea, as the creeping things,
\add that have\add* no ruler over them?\f + \fr 1.14  \ft creeping: or,
moving\f*

They take up all of them with the angle, they catch them in their
net, and gather them in their drag: therefore they rejoice and are
glad.\f + \fr 1.15  \ft drag: or, flue net\f*

Therefore they sacrifice unto their net, and burn incense
unto their drag; because by them their portion \add is\add* fat,
and their meat plenteous.\f + \fr 1.16  \ft plenteous: or, dainty: Heb.
fat\f*

Shall they therefore empty their net, and not spare continually
to slay the nations?

I will stand upon my watch, and set me upon the tower, and will
watch to see what he will say unto me, and what I shall answer when I am
reproved.\f + \fr 2.1  \ft tower: Heb. fenced place\f*\f + \fr 2.1 
\ft unto me: or, in me\f*\f + \fr 2.1  \ft when…: or, when I am argued with: Heb. upon my reproof, or,
arguing\f*

And the \nd LORD\nd* answered  me, and said, Write the vision, and make
\add it\add* plain upon tables, that he may run that readeth it.

For the vision \add is\add* yet for an appointed time, but at the
end it shall speak, and not lie: though it tarry, wait for it; because it will
surely come, it will not tarry.

Behold, his soul \add which\add* is lifted up is not upright
in him: but the just shall live by his faith.

¶ Yea also, because he transgresseth by wine, \add he is\add*
a proud man, neither keepeth at home, who enlargeth his desire as
hell, and \add is\add* as death, and cannot be satisfied, but gathereth
unto him all nations, and heapeth unto him all people:\f + \fr 2.5 
\ft Yea…: or, How much more\f*

Shall not all these take up a parable against him, and a taunting
proverb against him, and say, Woe to him that increaseth \add that which
is\add* not his! how long? and to him that ladeth himself with thick
clay!\f + \fr 2.6  \ft Woe…: or, Ho, he\f*

Shall they not rise up suddenly that shall bite thee, and awake
that shall vex thee, and thou shalt be for booties unto them?

Because thou hast spoiled many nations, all the remnant of the
people shall spoil thee; because of men’s blood, and \add for\add*
the violence of the land, of the city, and of all that dwell therein.\f + \fr 2.8 
\ft blood: Heb. bloods\f*

¶ Woe to him that coveteth an evil covetousness to his house,
that he may set his nest on high, that he may be delivered from the
power of evil!\f + \fr 2.9  \ft coveteth…: or, gaineth and evil gain\f*\f + \fr 2.9 
\ft power…: Heb. palm of the hand\f*

Thou hast consulted shame to thy house by cutting off many
people, and hast sinned \add against\add* thy soul.

For the stone shall cry out of the wall, and the beam out
of the timber shall answer it.\f + \fr 2.11  \ft beam: or, piece, or,
fastening\f*\f + \fr 2.11  \ft answer it: or, witness against it\f*

¶ Woe to him that buildeth a town with blood, and stablisheth
a city by iniquity!\f + \fr 2.12  \ft blood: Heb. bloods\f*

Behold, \add is it\add* not of the \nd LORD\nd* of hosts that the
people shall labour in the very fire, and the people shall weary
themselves for very vanity?\f + \fr 2.13  \ft for…: or, in vain?\f*

For the earth shall be filled with the knowledge of the glory
of the \nd LORD\nd*, as the waters cover the sea.\f + \fr 2.14  \ft with…: or, by knowing the
glory\f*

¶ Woe unto him that giveth his neighbour drink, that puttest
thy bottle to \add him\add*, and makest \add him\add* drunken also, that thou mayest
look on their nakedness!

Thou art filled with shame for glory: drink thou also, and let thy foreskin be
uncovered: the cup of the \nd LORD’s\nd* right hand shall be turned
unto thee, and shameful spewing \add shall be\add* on thy glory.\f + \fr 2.16 
\ft with…: or, more with shame than with glory\f*

For the violence of Lebanon shall cover thee, and the spoil
of beasts, \add which\add* made them afraid, because of men’s blood,
and for the violence of the land, of the city, and of all that dwell therein.

¶ What profiteth the graven image that the maker thereof hath
graven it; the molten image, and a teacher of lies, that the maker
of his work trusteth therein, to make dumb idols?\f + \fr 2.18  \ft maker of…: Heb. fashioner of his
fashion\f*

Woe unto him that saith to the wood, Awake; to the dumb stone,
Arise, it shall teach! Behold, it \add is\add* laid over with gold
and silver, and \add there is\add* no breath at all in the midst of it.

But the \nd LORD\nd* \add is\add* in his holy temple: let all the
earth keep silence before him.\f + \fr 2.20  \ft let…: Heb. be silent all the earth before
him\f*

A prayer of Habakkuk the prophet upon Shigionoth.\f + \fr 3.1 
\ft upon…: or, according to variable songs, or, tunes, called in Hebrew,
Shigionoth\f*

O \nd LORD\nd*, I have heard thy speech, \add and\add* was
afraid: O \nd LORD\nd*, revive thy work in the midst of the years,
in the midst of the years make known; in wrath remember mercy.\f + \fr 3.2 
\ft speech: Heb. report, or, hearing\f*\f + \fr 3.2  \ft revive: or, preserve
alive\f*

God came from Teman, and the Holy One from mount Paran. Selah.
His glory covered the heavens, and the earth was full of his praise.\f + \fr 3.3 
\ft Teman: or, the south\f*

And \add his\add* brightness was as the light; he had horns
\add coming\add* out of his hand: and there \add was\add* the hiding
of his power.\f + \fr 3.4  \ft horns…: or, bright beams out of his
side\f*

Before him went the pestilence, and burning coals went forth
at his feet.\f + \fr 3.5  \ft coals: or, diseases\f*

He stood, and measured the earth: he beheld, and drove asunder
the nations; and the everlasting mountains were scattered, the perpetual
hills did bow: his ways \add are\add* everlasting.

I saw the tents of Cushan in affliction: \add and\add* the
curtains of the land of Midian did tremble.\f + \fr 3.7  \ft Cushan: or,
Ethiopia\f*\f + \fr 3.7  \ft in…: or, under affliction, or, vanity\f*

Was the \nd LORD\nd* displeased  against the rivers? \add was\add*
thine anger against the rivers? \add was\add* thy wrath against the
sea, that thou didst ride upon thine horses \add and\add* thy chariots
of salvation?\f + \fr 3.8  \ft of…: or, were salvation?\f*

Thy bow was made quite naked, \add according\add* to the oaths
of the tribes, \add even thy\add* word. Selah. Thou didst cleave
the earth with rivers.\f + \fr 3.9  \ft earth…: or, rivers of the
earth\f*

The mountains saw thee, \add and\add* they trembled: the overflowing
of the water passed by: the deep uttered his voice, \add and\add*
lifted up his hands on high.

The sun \add and\add* moon stood still in their habitation:
at the light of thine arrows they went, \add and\add* at the shining
of thy glittering spear.\f + \fr 3.11  \ft at the light…: or, thine arrows walked in the
light\f*

Thou didst march through the land in indignation, thou didst
thresh the heathen in anger.

Thou wentest forth for the salvation of thy people, \add even\add*
for salvation with thine anointed; thou woundedst the head out of the
house of the wicked, by discovering the foundation unto the neck.
Selah.\f + \fr 3.13  \ft by…: Heb. making naked\f*

Thou didst strike through with his staves the head of his
villages: they came out as a whirlwind to scatter me: their rejoicing
\add was\add* as to devour the poor secretly.\f + \fr 3.14  \ft came…: Heb. were
tempestuous\f*

Thou didst walk through the sea with thine horses, \add through\add*
the heap of great waters.\f + \fr 3.15  \ft heap: or, mud\f*

When I heard, my belly trembled; my lips quivered at the voice:
rottenness entered into my bones, and I trembled in myself, that I might
rest in the day of trouble: when he cometh up unto the people, he will invade them with his
troops.\f + \fr 3.16  \ft invade…: or, cut them in pieces\f*

¶ Although the fig tree shall not blossom, neither \add shall\add*
fruit \add be\add* in the vines; the labour of the olive shall fail,
and the fields shall yield no meat; the flock shall be cut off from the
fold, and \add there shall be\add* no herd in the stalls:\f + \fr 3.17 
\ft fail: Heb. lie\f*

Yet I will rejoice in the \nd LORD\nd*, I will joy in the
God of my salvation.

The \nd LORD\nd* God \add is\add* my strength, and he will
make my feet like hinds’ \add feet\add*, and he will make me to walk
upon mine high places. To the chief singer on my stringed instruments.\f + \fr 3.19 
\ft chief…: or, overseer\f*\f + \fr 3.19  \ft stringed…: Heb. Neginoth\f*
